channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Park area, 2nd August
item.description:
Park is very run down Many kids enjoy this area as it’s all they have got. Fence been bent

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marvels Lane, Chinbrook, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped of carpets, underlay and rubbish bags, 2nd August
item.description:
Illegal flytipping of carpets, underlay and rubbish bags. Appeared overnight. Please can this be removed and could something be done to help prevent this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakfield Road, Anerley, London

item.title: A traffic cone abandoned outside No 19 Portsea Place, 2nd August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Portsea Place, Marylebone, London

item.title: Street cabinet knocked over on the pavement, 2nd August
item.description:
A street cabinet has been knocked over on the pavement and is a partial obstruction. The street cabinet may belong to a broadband provider such as BT or Virgin Media and there may be damage to cables. The location is in front of 276 High Road, N15.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 266, High Road, West Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rats in the drain, 2nd August
item.description:
Hello, I live at the basement level of 68 Allen Road and just saw two rats coming out of the drain on my terrace on the street side. My landlord has advised me to reach out to the Hackney council to let you know about this.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Allen Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Open rubbish, 2nd August
item.description:

item.title: Black bin bags ripped open., 2nd August
item.description:
These black bin bags which were not picked up on Thursday the collection day and are now ripped open all over the street, most of the rubbish has now blown down the road by the time this picture was taken on Friday. This is causing a significant hygiene and environmental issue. Please arrange for the waste to be collected urgently and investigate why it was missed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palmerston Crescent, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
